meaningMnemonic: You are <kanji>strong</kanji> so you break into someone's home, hold them up, then <kanji>steal</kanji> from them. Ha ha! Take that, next door neighbor! This is a <vocabulary>burglary</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>robbery</vocabulary>, depending on how crazy you get after you use that strength to break down that door.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. But 強  has two on'yomi readings, and you haven't really seen this one yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you out:

Think about how when you commit a <vocabulary>robbery</vocabulary>, you <reading>go</reading> (ごう) into someone's house, then you go to jail as well, if you're caught.
